result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Raymond Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Raymond Weber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Raymond Weber was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- Count 2 in Case 14CF320 dismissed

- Defendant to report to probation by 3:30 p.m. on 11-06-2015
Concurrent with: Polk County Case 13CF374

miscConds.notes:
-  $268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF320.
-  $200.00 DNA Surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case   #14CF320
-  In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- Defendant shall follow all recommendations for treatment at MN Adult Teen Challenge and shall complete treatment, including aftercare successfully
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's 
- Follow rules and regulations of agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Shall not possess a firearm

records.addlTxt: E: Probation. mw
c: DA, SCSO, Jail, Atty Chapman and Defendant. E: Probation
Sentencing checklist

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Michael Raymond Weber appeared. Case called at 2:45 p.m. Court reviews file. Letters were filed with the court regarding MN Teen Challenge and various letters. Atty Chapman is not requesting the information to be sealed. Court reviews plea questionnaire and rights. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1. Possession of THC. Court will find defendant GUILTY of Ct 1 on the information. Count 2 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court orders:

-  S/W 18 months probation concurrent with the Polk County supervision.180 days stayed condition time. Sign up for probation by 3:30 p.m. today. 2 days credit. 

-  Defendant shall follow all recommendations for treatment at MN Adult Teen Challenge and shall complete treatment, including aftercare, successfully

-  Court costs and $200.00 DNA Surcharge. To be paid over the course of probation

-  Any amounts posted for bail shall be applied to financial obligations. Any balance shall be returned to the person who posted the bail

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested

- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license

- Subject to random UA's and PBT's

- Follow rules and regulations of Agent

- Pay supervision fees

- Shall not possess a firearm
Plea hearing at 11-06-2015 02:45 pm

from ADA Correll via fax stating ADA Minser is not available to appear in Polk County today for the plea hearing on 14CF320. JA confirmed that they also received the fax and forwarded it to Polk County Clerk of Court as Judge Vlack is already in Polk County. ks
Plea hearing on September 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, Reporter T. Smith, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Michael Raymond Weber appeared. Case called at 10:38 am. Atty Chapman makes statement. Was set for a Plea date but parties request another date. Sentence to run concurrent to Polk County Sentence when sentenced. Next hearing maybe heard in Polk County. km  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Crandall. , Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Amber Hahn DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Michael Raymond Weber appeared via phone. Case called at 1:20 p.m.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on both counts.  Waives speedy trial. Both parties ask to be set for PTC. ADA Hahn asking for verification from Teen Challenge that he is still in the program to appear by phone. Atty Chapman and defendant have no objection to that.  Bond continues. hml  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

S/T Investigator Haefner identifies defendant in courtroom. ADA Hahn directs. Atty Chapman redirects. Witness released at 3:04 p.m. ADA Hahn Exhibit #1, JOC from Goodhue County, O/R. Court finds based on the testimony given by Investigator Haefner, enough probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Address confirmed. Bond continues. hml  Arraignment scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
